page.title: 06JANE WENHAM-LOCAL WITCH I
page.content: Jane Wenham was a lady who lived in the 17-hundreds. In 1711 when Jane was 70 years old,John Chapman told of a strange story.He said"My cattle were alright the night before it happened but the next morning all my cattle and horses were dead".He also said he had seen Jane Wenham standing there in a riding cloak.Chapman suspected that Jane Wenham had bewitched his cattle. Ann Thorne was the next one to get a taste of Jane's witchcraft.Somehow Ann had put her knee out of joint.She was lame but used to run around in country lanes. Jane went to a trial in Hertford.Jane was asked to say the Lords Prayer.She did,but went wrong at "Lead us not into temptation".She either said"Lead us into temptation"or "Lead us not into no temptation"......
